channel.title: hugo on codex
channel.description: Recent content in hugo on codex

item.title: Migrating to Hugo
item.description: Using Sapper and Strapi Currently I am in the process of converting my blog to a Sapper blog that will be statically exported to Netlify. The local headless CMS was built using Strapi. The tutorial I followed for this was pretty straight forward. There are two small things I’d add though. For one Strapi uses markdown and Sapper is going to render in html. I’d download the “marked” package and import it into in svelte file that will require markdown conversion.
